column4: can someone help me with this error, ./eggdrop: error while loading shared libraries: libtcl8.4.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
the file is there, why cant the sysem find it?
apt-cache search libtcl will probably find what you're afiter
libtcl is installed fine
root@phobos:/etc# whereis libtcl8.4.so
libtcl8.4: /usr/local/lib/libtcl8.4.so
ah, I can safely say you are on your own, since libtcl8 is local (you did it yourself) but, you could look into ld.so.conf (?)
until about 2 minuts ago(when i made it manually) id dint have a ld.so.conf but i really dont know the syntax
why do you have a local tcl, anyway? ubuntu comes with a perfectly useful one in the repositories
it wasnt working, so i installed it from source
it didnt help
well, I hope perfectly useful. It used to be.
did you have problems finding the files needed for tcl development?
eggdrp wont compile or work right
thats all i really care about tcl for
try installing tcl8.4-dev, or tclx8.4dev (a quick read, I haven't done any tcl for a long time)
actaully i got it, i just copied the tcl into /usr/lib
what works, works. But in the long term, learning the tools will help.
ive never had a problem with tcl with any other distro i have ever used.... i used apt get to get tcl, it disnt work, whats a person to do?
debian lays things out differently: you need to get the -dev files for compiling, and the names are not the ones you'd expect coming from mandriva-land
it's all a matter of semantics.
madrake ownz =p
